description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to support the watershed development component of PMKSY through technical assistance to improve incremental conservation outcomes and agricultural yields for communities in selected sites, and adoption of more effective processes and technologies in participating states.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :IUFR | Description :Participating States and State Level Nodal Agencies to prepare and furnish to theAssociation not later than forty-five (45) days after the end of each calendar quarter, quarterly interim unaudited financialreports for the Project, satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :National Institute of Hydrology | Description :National Institute of Hydrology shall be an implementing agencyto support the implementation of the activities required under Part2(c) of the Financial Agreement of the Project in a mannersatisfactory to the Bank | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Reports | Description :Prepare Project Reports covering the period of one calendar semester and furnishto the Association not later than one (1) month after the end of the period covered by such report. | Frequency :Quarterly

title.narrative: Component 1 - Strengthen the institutions and human resources of key stakeholders to improve effective implementation of watershed management
Component 2: Establish a coordinated approach to provide practical knowledge and tools to support integrated watershed management
Component 3: Demonstrate successful implementation of rainfed agriculture and watershed development programs, with a science-basedapproach
Component 4: Ensure effective, efficient and responsive project management
Increased average % gain in incremental productivity of arable lands in selected MWSs above baseline
2-b. Basic hydrological monitoring systems installed and functional at community level in maximum of 400 selected sub-watersheds (no. of SWSs covered)
3-f. Operational water user associations created and/or strengthened (number)
1-a. Web based knowledge sharing system established at central level for integrated WSD and fully functional, measured by number of visitors (no. of visitors)
Number of new approaches, developed under the project, that are integrated into National watershed guidelines.
2-a. MET stations and systems in place in selected SWSs, and data flowing to communities on a regular basis (no. of SWSs covered)
3-d. Hydrological assessment used by states as part of watershed planning (no. of sites)
3-g. % of farmers adopting improved soil moisture conservation and production technologies in selected sites
1-b. Functioning M&E cells in State Level Nodal Agencies in participating project states (no. of states)
3-e. Digitized database fully operational in project states (no. of states)
4-b. Effective project management (% of concurrent monitoring recommendations each year, acted upon during implementation)
PDO 1-b. Average incremental changes in overall watershed biomass (NDVI values) in selected sites
PDO 2-e. Cereals (baseline and end target measured tons/ha)
PDO 2-b. Vegetables (baseline and end target measured in tons/ha)
PDO 1-a. Average incremental reduction in soil loss (t/ha/year) selected sites to be treated in medium rainfall areas 700 -1,000 mm/yr (baseline and end targets measured in tons/ha/year)
PDO 2-a. Milk (baseline and end target measured in litres/ lacation)
4-a. IWMP disbursement ratio in participating project states increases over baseline
PDO 2-c. Oilseeds (baseline and end target measured in tons/ha)
PDO 2-d. Pulses (baseline and end target measured in tons/ha)
3-c. DSS models used to support for IWMP planning (no. of states)
3-a. Changes in average groundwater levels (post monsoon) in project sites in meters below ground level depth in selected sites (measured in no. of meters below ground level)
3-b. Changes in average groundwater levels (pre-moonson) in project sites in meters below ground level depth in selected sites (measured in no. of meters below ground level)
